citations.narrative:
The facility failed to notify USDA prior to adding a new type of animal to their business which is not approved on the
facility's current license. The facility currently has a serval cat on exhibit, but the facility's existing exhibitor's license does
not authorize the use of exotic cats. Specific approval of dangerous animal groups including exotic and wild felids (cats) is
important for compliance with Animal Welfare Act regulations and is required in order to assess the facility's knowledge
and ability to safely maintain dangerous animals. Correct by 7/13/23 by stopping the exhibition of this animal, and by re-
applying for a new, updated exhibitor's license that includes exotic and wild felids (cats) and any other dangerous animal
groups the licensee exhibits.

Records of acquisition and disposition were incomplete. Some records lacked the address and driver's license number of
the animal seller/donor. Records of disposition were missing entirely for some animals. Accurate recordkeeping is
important for animal traceability in the event of disease outbreaks or investigation of animals lost or stolen. Correct by
8/13/23 by updating/completing existing animal records and capturing all of the required information on future records.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
